newsitem.title: POLAND: Coal trader, KGHM are Poland's top exporters - report.
newsitem.headline: Coal trader, KGHM are Poland's top exporters - report.

text.p: Poland's coal trader Weglokoks SA was Poland's top exporter in 1996 at $890 million and copper producer KGHM Polska Miedz SA was second with $785 million according to a ranking by the independent BOSS news agency.

A BOSS Import-Export report said on Monday that in its annual ranking the Polish unit of Italian Fiat Spa, Fiat Auto Polska SA, was the country's third leading exporter at $776 million and second biggest importer at $731 million.
The ranking of top importers was led by the country's biggest refinery Petrochemia Plock SA with $1.68 billion worth of imports and another refiner Rafineria Gdanska SA was third at $489 million.
The report said the share of biggest companies in Poland's foreign trade fell slightly with the top 100 firms in both rankings accounting for 34.9 percent of exports and 30.9 percent of imports.
The Top 100 exporters sold last year $8.53 billion worth of goods while top 100 importers bought $11.46 billion.

BOSS said foreign firms had a high share of foreign trade with 46 foreign-controlled firms represented in the importers' top 100. BOSS did not say how many foreign-conrolled firms were in the top 100 exporters.

BOSS said the ranking of importers was dominated by refineries and fuels distributors which accounted for 7.5 percent of Poland's total imports and automotive firms, which had a 6.6 percent share in the country's imports.
RANK COMPANY INDUSTRY IMPORTS SHARE IN TOTAL
